title: NYC shooting victims honored before HOF game
content: The NFL held a moment of silence before Thursday's Hall of Fame Game to honor the four people killed earlier this week by a shooter who was targeting league headquarters in New York.

title: Correa returning to Astros, this time to play 3B
content: Carlos Correa is returning to the Astros, with the veteran waiving his no-trade clause in order to return to his previous home of seven seasons. Houston also acquired OF Jesus Sanchez from the Marlins.

title: Knicks, Bridges agree to 4-year, $150M extension
content: New York Knicks forward Mikal Bridges has agreed to a four-year, $150 million contract extension with the franchise, his agents told ESPN's Shams Charania on Thursday.

title: Dealing Pads get O'Hearn, Laureano for 6 players
content: The Padres have acquired first baseman Ryan O'Hearn and outfielder Ramon Laureano from the Orioles in exchange for six minor-league players.

title: Rangers get Kelly from D-backs to add to rotation
content: The Rangers are acquiring right-handed starting pitcher Merrill Kelly from the Diamondbacks in exchange for three pitchers, sources told ESPN.

title: Yanks add Bednar, Doval; say Williams still closer
content: The Yankees added bullpen reinforcements by trading for David Bednar, Camilo Doval and Jake Bird on Thursday, while manager Aaron Boone said the plan is to keep the incumbent Devin Williams in the closer role.

title: Red Sox add to staff, acquire May from Dodgers
content: The Red Sox acquired starter Dustin May from the Dodgers on Thursday, filling their need for pitching help. Los Angeles received outfield prospect James Tibbs III in return.

title: Who makes the Year 2 leap? The top 10 sophomores to watch for the 2025-26 NBA season
content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: New Hall of Famer Antonio Gates was a beloved teammate, remains a San Diego legend
content: Gates transformed the tight end position, and he remains remarkable to those who witnessed his exploits.

title: Rio Takeda, Eri Okayama share lead at Women's Open
content: Rio Takeda overcame a double bogey at the turn with four birdies over her final seven holes Thursday for a 5-under 67 to share the lead with Eri Okayama in a Women's British Open that featured a Japanese surge and a mixed day for Lottie Woad.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Newcastle eye Woltemade
content: Both Manchester United and Newcastle United are looking to sign Stuttgart forward Nick Woltemade. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Premier League 2025-26 kit ranking: Every new jersey released so far
content: Why should you have to wait until all of the Premier League kits are out before you see them ranked? Here's every 2025-26 jersey that's been released.

title: Rays add White Sox's Houser, Twins' Jax to staff
content: Adrian Houser, who was released by the Rangers and has shined since being picked up by the White Sox, has now been traded to the Rays, who also picked up Griffin Jax from the Twins for Taj Bradley.

title: Phillies fill outfield need, get Bader from Twins
content: The Phillies filled a need in their outfield by acquiring 2021 Gold Glove-winner Harrison Bader from the Twins.

title: Tigers get Nats closer Finnegan to fortify bullpen
content: The Tigers, in an effort to bolster their weakest link for a World Series run, have acquired closer Kyle Finnegan from the Nationals for two minor leaguers.

title: Padres acquire closer Miller, lefty Sears from A's
content: The San Diego Padres have acquired Mason Miller in a trade with the Athletics, adding the hard-throwing reliever to their already talented bullpen.

title: Mariners land slugging 3B Suarez from D-backs
content: The Mariners have acquired slugging third baseman Eugenio Su√°rez from the Diamondbacks in exchange for three prospects.

title: Red Sox add to staff, acquire Matz from Cards
content: The Red Sox struck a deal with the Cardinals for veteran left-hander Steven Matz, with Boston sending minor league first baseman Blaze Jordan to St. Louis in return.

title: Cubs add righty Soroka, send 2 prospects to Nats
content: The Cubs acquired pitcher Mike Soroka from the Nationals for two prospects and reliever Andrew Kittredge from the Orioles for another prospect.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: The real most valuable players on every NFL team: Who would return multiple first-round picks via trade?
content: This exhaustive NFL trade guide factors in ability, positional value, contracts and age to figure out which players are really worth a first-round pick.

title: Five trades that make too much sense: Which teams should make a deal now?
content: As teams look to finalize their rosters, Seth Walder proposes trades that could help all sides involved.

title: Wetzel: Next NFLPA boss should understand the job
content: NFLPA adventure with Howell shows the union has lost focus in finding leaders driven to represent labor.

title: How billionaire Mike Repole plans to change the vibe of the UFL, expand it to 16 teams
content: MIke Repole is taking over business operations for the UFL and promises market changes and a livelier product.

title: What to know ahead of the Hungarian Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 heads to Budapest for round 14 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the last race weekend before the summer break.

title: NASCAR taking shots in experimentation and making many of them
content: The NASCAR schedule used to be predictable. Now, though, it's constantly evolving, and the series deserves credit for its bravery.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Taira can avoid an upset loss at UFC Fight Night
content: Din Thomas makes his pick for Taira vs. Park and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: Boxing real or not: Joshua vs. Paul? Can Pacquiao win a title? Who's the best featherweight?
content: Nick Parkinson discusses what could be next for Anthony Joshua, Manny Pacquiao, Teofimo Lopez and Oleksandr Usyk.

title: Crude calculations: Trump's oil deal with Pak - a move to counter China, pressure India?
content: Donald Trump's announcement of a deal to develop Pakistan's oil reserves is viewed with skepticism. Experts suggest it's a strategic move to counter China's influence and pressure India on trade, rather than a reflection of Pakistan's immediate hydrocarbon potential. The viability of these reserves remains unproven, requiring significant investment and time, especially given the risky locations.

title: IND vs ENG, 5th Test: Overcast sky, green pitch, moving ball - welcome to England, Day 1
content: The first day of the fifth England-India Test at The Oval favored England, with India struggling to 204/6 on a spicy, bowler-friendly pitch. Rain interruptions and inconsistent bowling, barring Gus Atkinson, added to India's woes. Despite Karun Nair's resilient fifty, aided by Washington Sundar, India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate hopes they can reach 300, praising Sai Sudharsan's patient innings.

title: 'Was fighting lunatics like you': Trump slams reporter over tariff question - watch video
content: During a White House press conference, President Trump clashed with a reporter, labeling him a "lunatic" for questioning the timing of invoking the IEEPA to impose tariffs. Trump defended his actions, citing previous tariffs on China and accusing the media of inadequate coverage.

title: LinkedIn cofounder Reid Hoffman says: There's a problem with Blue states and they need to ‚Ä¶
content: Reid Hoffman admits that the Democratic Party alienated Silicon Valley. This drove tech leaders towards Donald Trump. He says attacks on cryptocurrency and Big Tech companies caused this shift. Hoffman points to California's regulations as a problem. He notes companies like Aurora Innovation tested in Texas due to better rules. He urges Democrats to adopt business-friendly policies.

title: Is Yuzvendra Chahal dating RJ Mahvash? India cricketer clears the air
content: Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal has addressed rumours linking him to RJ Mahvash after his divorce from Dhanashree Verma. He clarified he is not dating anyone and needs time to heal, expressing fear of future heartbreak. Chahal explained that photos with Mahvash were misinterpreted, leading to online trolling and false accusations against her.

title: 'I just wanted to ... ': Chahal explains viral 'be your own sugar daddy' tee during divorce saga
content: Yuzvendra Chahal has opened up about his divorce from Dhanashree Verma and the story behind his viral T-shirt. Speaking on a podcast, Chahal revealed the emotional distress he faced and his decision to wear the ‚Äúbe your own sugar daddy‚Äù T-shirt as a message. He clarified that the divorce was a gradual decision, influenced by career pressures and differing goals.

title: Solar Eclipse that will see the 'world to go dark for six mins' on Aug 2: What Nasa says
content: Contrary to viral claims, the world won't experience a six-minute blackout on August 2, 2025. NASA confirms a total solar eclipse will occur on August 2, 2027, darkening parts of Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East.

title: Cong vs Cong: Rahul backs Trump‚Äôs ‚Äòdead economy‚Äô remark; Tharoor, Shukla contradict him
content: Amidst Rahul Gandhi's endorsement of Trump's "dead economy" remark, Congress leaders like Rajeev Shukla and Shashi Tharoor offered differing perspectives. Shukla refuted Trump's assessment, emphasizing India's economic strength and past reforms. Tharoor viewed US tariffs as a potential bargaining tactic during ongoing trade negotiations, urging support for negotiators while acknowledging potential damage to exports if a favorable deal isn't reached.

title: Not a single person has accepted the offer: Murati on her team rejecting Zuckerberg‚Äôs $1 bn offer
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI talent faced a significant setback as Thinking Machines Lab, led by Mira Murati, reportedly rejected lucrative offers, some reaching a billion dollars, to join Meta's Superintelligence Lab. Murati's team prioritized independence and long-term vision over substantial financial gains, highlighting the allure of shaping AI's future outside a corporate giant.

title: Saiyaara collection day 14: Ahaan & Aneet's film earns Rs 6.5 cr on second Thursday
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's romantic film 'Saiyaara' continues its successful box office run, earning Rs 6.50 crore on its 14th day, bringing the total domestic collection to Rs 280.50 crore. Despite facing competition from new releases like 'Kingdom', the film is holding strong, although experiencing a dip in daily collections.

title: Luka Doncic -Supports LeBron‚Äôs Lakers Retirement - Despite Tensions in Los Angeles
content: Luka Doncic has reportedly expressed his desire for LeBron James to remain with the Los Angeles Lakers, despite rumors of tension and a potential trade that brought Doncic to the team. Doncic is said to be actively building around James, hoping the NBA legend will finish his career with the Lakers, even as Doncic prepares to sign a contract extension.

title: Timberlake reveals Lyme disease battle: Symptoms, struggles; what fans should know
content: Justin Timberlake disclosed his battle with Lyme disease after concluding his Forget Tomorrow World Tour. He endured chronic pain and fatigue throughout 90 shows. Despite considering quitting, he found joy in performing. Timberlake hopes to connect with others facing similar health challenges. Lyme disease is very common in the US.

title: 'India not great global actor‚Äô: Trump admin fires fresh salvo, says Russia oil ‚Äòpoint of irritation‚Äô
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expressed frustration with India's trade practices, particularly its purchase of sanctioned Russian oil, leading to potential penalties and tariffs. President Trump's administration is reportedly displeased with India's slow pace in trade negotiations. Experts suggest these actions are pressure tactics to expedite a trade deal, especially as the US secures agreements with other major partners.

title: Travis Kelce keeps distance: Blake Lively drama looms ‚Äî Taylor Swift‚Äôs love life in spotlight
content: Amid Blake Lively's legal issues involving Justin Baldoni, Travis Kelce has remained a supportive presence for Taylor Swift. Kelce, reportedly wary of Ryan Reynolds' "Hollywood" persona, has always prioritized Swift's well-being. The couples, once frequently seen together, have seemingly distanced themselves, with Lively and Reynolds absent from the recent Super Bowl, signaling a potential shift in Swift's friendships.

title: Shannon Sharpe lawsuit twist: OnlyFans model settles ‚Äî payout reportedly far below $50M
content: NFL legend Shannon Sharpe settled a lawsuit with a 20-year-old OnlyFans model. The model initially sued Sharpe for $50 million, alleging sexual assault. Sources indicate Sharpe paid $23 million to resolve the case. Both parties acknowledge a consensual relationship. The model's lawyer confirmed a mutually agreed resolution. Sharpe has not commented publicly on the settlement. He continues his podcast work.

title: Edmonton Oilers take bold stand: Carter Hart controversy ignites ‚Äî NHL fans nationwide outraged
content: Edmonton Oilers will likely not sign Carter Hart. NHL insider Frank Seravalli reported this news. Hart and four others were acquitted in the Hockey Canada Five case. However, the NHL has restricted them from playing. The league will review the case. Oilers have previously offered second chances to players. But sources indicate a change in approach.

title: Rummy row: Maharashtra mantri loses agri portfolio, gets sports, minority departments
content: Following a rummy controversy, NCP leader Ajit Pawar reassigned Agriculture Minister Manikrao Kokate to Sports and Youth Welfare, Minority Development, and Waqf. Dattatray Bharne will now head the agriculture department. This demotion followed Kokate's apology for the incident and assurances of improved behavior.

title: Connor McDavid extension talks: Edmonton Oilers optimistic ‚Äî GM Stan Bowman ‚Äòencouraged‚Äô
content: Edmonton Oilers are eager to extend Connor McDavid's contract. General Manager Stan Bowman is optimistic after initial talks. McDavid's current contract ends in 2026. He is eligible for an extension since July 1. McDavid wants to win a Stanley Cup with the Oilers. His decision will also consider his personal life.

title: 'Gill made batting look easy, but ‚Ä¶': Ryan rues captain's run-out, defends Bumrah omission
content: India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate acknowledged the impact of Shubman Gill's unfortunate run-out and Jasprit Bumrah's absence on the first day of the fifth Test against England. Despite these setbacks and ending the day at 204/6, he praised Karun Nair and Washington Sundar's resilience. Ten Doeschate remains optimistic, hoping the team can reach 300, considering it a competitive score.

title: 'Had suicidal thoughts': Chahal breaks silence on divorce, mental health battle
content: Yuzvendra Chahal revealed the emotional distress and mental health challenges he faced during his divorce from Dhanashree Verma. He addressed rumours of infidelity and admitted to struggling with suicidal thoughts due to the immense pressure. Chahal emphasised the mutual decision for separation, highlighting the incompatibility arising from their career-focused lives.

title: 'Dead economies' vs 'dead hand': Medvedev trades Cold War insults to Trump's remark
content: President Trump escalated tensions with India by imposing tariffs and penalty charges, dismissing their relationship with Russia. He then targeted Dmitry Medvedev, calling him a "failed former President," triggering a sharp response. Medvedev retorted that Trump's reaction proved Russia was right and alluded to the "Dead Hand" concept, a Cold War-era nuclear deterrent, in response to Trump's "dead economies" remark.

title: Yuzvendra Chahal finally reveals reason behind divorce with Dhanashree: 'It was going on for..'
content: Yuzvendra Chahal has finally addressed his divorce from Dhanashree Verma, revealing it was a gradual decision. He admitted they hoped things might improve, maintaining a public image while privately struggling. Chahal cited conflicting careers and inability to spend quality time as key factors, highlighting the emotional toll and eventual decision to part ways.

title: Gabrielle Union opens up: Motherhood at 40, post-divorce ‚Äî Dwyane Wade‚Äôs wife gets real
content: Gabrielle Union, actress and wife of Dwyane Wade, shared insights with Marie Claire about embracing motherhood in her mid-40s via surrogacy, welcoming their daughter Kaavia. Union highlighted that she wouldn't have experienced such joy or financial stability earlier in life. She also emphasized the importance of a stable partnership with Wade for raising children, extending beyond their formative years.

title: Donald Trump‚Äôs 25% tariff, ‚Äòdead economy‚Äô jibe: India's message to US in 5 points - details
content: In response to US President Trump's tariffs and criticisms, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has asserted that national interests would not be compromised in any trade deal. He has highlighted India's rapid economic growth, its rise to a top-five economy, and its commitment to becoming self-sufficient.

title: US tariff: Trump‚Äôs rant against India undercuts his own Op Sindoor ceasefire claims - here's how
content: Donald Trump's recent criticism of India's tariffs contradicts his earlier assertion that he influenced India to halt 'Operation Sindoor' against Pakistan by threatening trade restrictions. This outburst occurred amidst parliamentary debates in India, where PM Modi refuted Trump's claim of mediation, attributing the cessation to the IAF's successful strikes.

title: 'The way she was tortured': Uma Bharti remembers Pragya Thakur, hails Malegaon verdict
content: Uma Bharti welcomed the Malegaon blast verdict. She insisted that terror has no colour. Bharti demanded an apology from Congress and Digvijay Singh. She criticized the 'Hindu terror' narrative. Bharti remembered Pragya Thakur and her suffering. She blamed political parties for 'Bhagwa terror' label. Bharti said those who fabricated lies must be punished.

title: 'Shouldn't have done that': Ex-India coach slams umpire Dharmasena ‚Äî Watch
content: Former India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has criticised umpire Kumar Dharmasena for signaling an inside edge during the India-England Test, sparking debate. Bangar emphasised that Dharmasena's gesture, a habit from pre-DRS days, could influence the bowling team, undermining impartiality. India struggled, losing early wickets, including Shubman Gill's run-out, ending the session at 85/3 in their bid to level the series.

title: Trump vows to help Pak tap 'massive oil reserves': How it compares to India - top points
content: Donald Trump announced a US-Pakistan deal to develop Pakistan's 'massive oil reserves,' even saying that India may be a potential buyer. Despite Pakistan's claims of coastal petroleum, extraction progress remains limited. Pakistan relies heavily on Middle Eastern oil imports, constituting 20% of its import expenses.

title: EC worker's children burnt to death in Patna; charred bodies found on bed
content: A tragic incident has unfolded in Patna's Janipur locality, where the burnt bodies of two children were discovered in their home. Police have initiated an investigation into the cause of the deaths, which remain unknown at this time. The children's mother is employed as a security guard at AIIMS Patna, while their father works in the Election Commission, according to authorities.

title: Chad Johnson to ESPN? Shannon Sharpe‚Äôs shock exit stirs buzz ‚Äî analyst role up for grabs
content: Shannon Sharpe's departure from ESPN's First Take, following a lawsuit settlement, has opened the door for Chad Johnson, who has expressed interest in filling the vacant role. Sharpe voiced concerns that the news overshadowed his brother's Hall of Fame induction, while also expressing gratitude for his time at ESPN. Johnson has already playfully auditioned for the position.

title: Ishita Dutta hospitalised with two-year-old son Vaayu; shares update on their recovery
content: Ishita Dutta and her son Vaayu were hospitalized due to health issues, causing her to spend time away from her newborn. Despite the challenges, both are now recovering well. Ishita also addressed her recent weight loss, attributing it to her illness and a healthy postpartum diet, including breastfeeding and homemade meals.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Don‚Äôt know why he was upset': Ganguly on Gambhir-curator spat
content: Former captain Sourav Ganguly has downplayed the recent heated exchange between India's head coach Gautam Gambhir and Oval pitch curator Lee Fortis, emphasising that such disagreements are common in cricket. The incident, where Gambhir was reportedly upset about pitch access, follows a series of tense moments in the India-England series.

title: Coconut water may not be for everyone: 6 types of people who should avoid drinking it
content: Coconut water, despite its hydrating and nourishing qualities, isn't for everyone. Individuals with diabetes need to be cautious due to its natural sugar content. Those with kidney disorders should avoid it because of high potassium levels. People on certain medications for high blood pressure or electrolyte-restricted diets should also exercise caution. Allergy sufferers should stay alert for adverse reactions.

title: Kwame Brown fires shots: Gilbert Arenas‚Äô arrest jab ‚Äî Shannon Sharpe‚Äôs ESPN exit mocked
content: Gilbert Arenas' arrest for running an illegal gambling operation and Shannon Sharpe's departure from ESPN have stirred controversy. Kwame Brown seized the opportunity to criticize both figures, posting a celebratory video online. Brown's reaction stems from a long-standing feud with Sharpe, while Arenas faces legal repercussions for his involvement in the illegal poker game.

title: Hulk Hogan death: Sudden passing stuns fans ‚Äî official cause revealed after a week
content: Wrestling legend Hulk Hogan passed away at 71 due to a heart attack. He died at his Florida home. Hogan battled underlying health issues like atrial flutter and leukemia. His family, including his spouse and children, expressed their grief. The wrestling world mourned the loss of the iconic figure. WWE paid tribute to Hogan on Monday Night Raw.

title: Lost song of the Sundarbans‚Äô fisherfolk
content: Dwindling incomes from fishing and the resultant migration of fishermen to states like Kerala and Andhra Pradesh is taking a toll on the folk arts of West Bengal

title: The lives of inland fisherfolk in Tamil Nadu
content: In Southern and Western Tamil Nadu, inland fishermen use simple tools and a work ethic that does not exploit nature‚Äôs resources

content: Photographer Assavri Kulkarni‚Äôs project assumes greater importance at a time when fish is being eaten out of season

title: In Bengaluru, meter off, fares up
content: The Regional Transport Authority of Bengaluru Urban district revised auto fares in the city limits on July 14, with the new rates coming into effect from August 1. While auto drivers are unhappy with the increase, commuters question the relevance of the decision when meters are hardly used and surge pricing by app-based aggregators is the norm

title: Review: Bride in the Hills | A Kuvempu magnum opus for the English reader
content: Set in the late 19th-century, this recent translation of the legendary Kannada writer‚Äôs 1967 novel is an exemplary work of social realism

content: Adept with harpoons in winter and nets in summer, the fishing communities here are relying on the government to save their lakes

title: Agrarian Rayalaseema‚Äôs dream for an industrial future
content: As mega industrial corridors and expressways reshape Rayalaseema‚Äôs landscape, an industrial future is poised to dawn over the region, which is grappling with declining agriculture and rising unemployment. The transformation has spurred interest in Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises among the youth, with many already scripting success. K. Umashanker speaks to the farmers who parted with their land for infrastructure development and the entrepreneurs betting big on economic boom

title: Cherlapalli terminal: All aboard the hype, but mind the gaps
content: Inaugurated with much fanfare as Hyderabad‚Äôs next big rail hub, the ‚Çπ430-crore Cherlapalli terminal was envisioned as a modern, congestion-busting alternative to Secunderabad station. But seven months after opening, the terminal remains hobbled by poor access roads, inadequate public transport, incomplete infrastructure and a disconnect between vision and execution. While the facade screams ambition, the functionality is far from future-ready, finds¬†V. Geetanath

title: Export Facilitation Centres supporting MSMEs, says Union Minister
content: In Andhra Pradesh alone, 50 MSMEs received support through the EFCs during 2024‚Äì25, Ms.¬† Karandlaje said

title: In Gurugram, silence in the service lanes
content: Gurugram Police in Haryana began a drive about a month ago to identify Bangladeshi nationals living illegally in the National Capital Region‚Äôs corporate capital. However, according to those living in the shadows of the city‚Äôs high-rise structures, the ongoing raids target Bengali-speaking migrants employed in the informal sector. The police action has thrown many workers into a panic, forcing them out of the city and putting their livelihoods in jeopardy, while shrinking Gurugram‚Äôs service support workforce

title: I was in love with Kavin, but my parents are ‚Äòinnocent‚Äô: Subhashini
content: According to her, Surjith wanted Kavin to meet her parents as he felt her marriage would pave way for his ‚Äúprogress‚Äù

content: ACB booked a case against him for ‚Äòmanipulating‚Äô tender processes while he was Director General of A.P. State Disaster Response & Fire Services

content: The YSRCP chief calls on former MLAs ‚Äî Kakani Govardhan Reddy in prison and Prasanna Kumar Reddy at his residence

content: The killing of Parvez is part of a chilling pattern of violence, with over a dozen Gujjar-Bakerwal men dying in suspicious circumstances in 2024-25, the former CM said

content: United States President Donald Trump on July 30 announced a 25% tariff on Indian goods from August 1, with an additional but unspecified ‚Äúpenalty‚Äù for its defence and energy imports from Russia

content: Odisha CM emphasised planting of climate-resilient and fruit-bearing species, tailored to local ecological conditions

content: The two term MLA and cabinet minister in Uttar Pradesh government, Mr. Rajbhar asserted that he is in talks with the NDA but if not given respectable seats then ready to go solo.

content: The Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav claimed that the government was forced to take back the decision due to the opposition pressure and protest

content: The hike in honorarium to community Durga Pujas from ‚Çπ85,000 last year to ‚Çπ1.1 lakh this year comes months ahead of Assembly polls in West Bengal.

content: The Cabinet meetings between July 28 till July 31 were chaired by Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu in which several decisions were taken

title: GCDA plans to transfer KK Road to Kochi Corporation after restoration work
content: While the GCDA can undertake minor repair works, such as filling potholes, large-scale restoration works and resurfacing are not feasible, unlike the Corporation, which has a separate allocation for road maintenance

content: District Police Chief asked to probe reasons leading to the death of a student after being fatally knocked down by bus

content: The district authorities had filed a report before the tribunal stating that they were yet to receive a response from the government regarding the award of compensation, as it involved a substantial amount

content: Affected stretches will be resurfaced once the rain subsides, says Mayor; PWD, GIDA, GCDA, NHAI told to take action in the case of roads under their control

content: Dattatrey Bharne, the current Sports Minister, will be the new Agriculture Minister, said a notification issued by the General Administration Department

content: The development comes at a time when security agencies are cracking down on Bangladeshi nationals in different parts of the country including West Bengal.

content: T.R.B. Rajaa said Tamil Nadu was prepared to face the tariffs even before Donald Trump was elected as the U.S. President

content: People are being detained by the police simply because they speak a certain dialect or wear a particular garment

content: A Bench headed by Justice Surya Kant asked the Centre to verify the information and consider providing the necessary environmental clearance

content: The line which is called Blue Line or ORR-Airport Metro Line consists of two sections - Phase-2A (Central Silk Board to Krishnarajapura) and Phase-2B (Krishnarajapura to Airport).¬†

title: RSS, VHP hail court‚Äôs decision on Malegaon blast
content: The court in Mumbai on Thursday acquitted all seven accused, noting there was ‚Äúno reliable and cogent evidence‚Äù against them.

content: High Courts across India have over 63 lakh cases pending; more than 86,000 cases are pending in the Supreme Court

title: Lt. Gen. Pushpendra Singh named new army Vice-Chief
content: Vice Admiral Sanjay Vatsayan, set to be the next VCNS, will take charge on August 1, confirmed a senior official.

title: Cabinet approves four multi-tracking projects costing ‚Çπ11,169 crore
content: The projects include Itarsi‚ÄìNagpur 4th¬†Line, Aurangabad-Parbhani Doubling, Aluabari Road-New Jalpaiguri 3rd¬†and 4th¬†Line as well as Dangoaposi-Jaroli 3rd¬†and 4th¬†Line; the project will enhance connectivity to about 2,309 villages, with population of about 43.60 lakh

title: Palaniswami promises protection to traditional fishermen, holds meeting with weavers
content: The former Chief Minister says if elected to power in 2026 elections, the AIADMK will take up the issue of fishermen with the Union government; country boat fishermen submit memorandum

title: EVMs are tamper-proof, ECI says, after checking and verification process
content: The ECI stressed that the C&V had been successfully conducted on 48 ballot units, 31 control units, and 31 VVPATs of 10 Assembly constituencies

title: "Good To See...": PM Modi Lauds Omar Abdullah's Statue Of Unity Visit
content: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday expressed happiness over Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah enjoying his visit to Gujarat, and said his visit to the Statue of Unity will inspire fellow Indians to travel to different parts of the country.

title: US Tariffs India Highlights: "Will Take All Steps For Nation's Interest": Piyush Goyal On Trump's Tariff Shocker
content: US Tariffs On India LIVE Updates: Hours after announcing 25 per cent tariffs on Indian imports, US President Donald Trump has hit out at New Delhi and its trading partner Moscow.

title: Trump Announces New US Tariffs. List Of Worst-Hit Countries
content: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday imposing reciprocal tariffs ranging from 10% to 41% on U.S. imports from dozens of countries and foreign locations.

title: Trump Says Russia's Actions In Ukraine "Disgusting"
content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday sharply criticized Russia's "disgusting" behavior against Ukraine and said he plans to impose sanctions on Moscow if no agreement can be reached.

title: Trump Increases Tariff On Canada To 35% Ahead Of Trade Deadline
content: Trump has warned that any country that does not strike a deal with the U.S. before Friday will be subjected to higher tariffs imposed on goods.

title: Best July Air Quality In Delhi's History, Says Environment Minister
content: Delhi has recorded its cleanest July in decades, with 29 out of 31 days falling under the 'Good' or 'Satisfactory' air quality categories, the best performance for the month in the city's documented history, to the government data.

title: Brazil Vows To Fight Trump Tariff "Injustice"
content: Brazil vowed Thursday to combat US President Donald Trump's tariffs on its exports, saying it intends to lodge appeals if last-ditch negotiations fail.

title: Zelensky Urges Allies To Seek "Regime Change" In Russia
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Thursday urged his allies to bring about "regime change" in Russia, hours after a Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv killed 16 people including a six-year-old boy.

title: Commercial LPG Cylinder Price Cut By Rs 33.50; New Rates Effective From Today
content: Oil marketing companies have reduced the price of a 19 kg commercial LPG gas cylinder by Rs 33.50, with the revised rates coming into effect from Thursday.

title: "If Cases Filed For Feeding Pigeons, Why Not For Strays": Ex-Minister To NDTV
content: Former Union Minister Vijay Goel has called for legal action against individuals feeding stray dogs in public places in Delhi, citing rising cases of dog bites across the capital.

title: Car Rams Bike Over Love Triangle, Teen Killed, DMK Man's Grandson Arrested
content: Three youngsters -- one of them the grandson of a DMK councillor -- have been arrested after their Range Rover car hit a two-wheeler in Chennai. The pillion rider, Nithin Sai, a college student died.

title: Himanta Sarma On Why NIA Should Probe Case Linked To Congress Leader's Wife
content: A day after Himanta Biswa Sarma hinted at transferring an ongoing state inquiry - into 'links' between Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi's wife and a Pakistan-based non-governmental organisation - to the National Investigation Agency, he explained why.

title: Delhi High Court Judge Recuses From Hearing Sanjay Bhandari's Plea Challenging 'Fugitive Offender' Tag
content: A judge of the Delhi High Court on Thursday recused himself from hearing a plea by UK-based arms consultant Sanjay Bhandari challenging a trial court's order declaring him a "fugitive economic offender".

title: Assaulted By 'Rescuers': Girl Accompanied By Kerala Nuns Who Were Arrested
content: Two nuns from Kerala along with Sukaman Mandavi were arrested in Chhattisgarh on accusations of forcibly converting three women and trafficking them.

title: Tripura State Rifles Jawan Among 4 Killed As Car Crashes With Police Van
content: Four persons, including a jawan of the Tripura State Rifles (TSR), were killed when a speeding vehicle hit a police van in Unakoti district, police said on Thursday.

title: 13-Year-Old Kidnapped For Ransom In Bengaluru, Burnt Body Recovered
content: The burnt body of a 13-year-old boy who had been reported missing on Wednesday was found at a deserted area along Kaggalipura Road in Bengaluru.

title: Trump Warns Pharma Companies To Cut Prices Or Be Punished
content: US President Donald Trump told major pharmaceutical firms Thursday to lower prices or face punishment, as he moved to give Americans relief from medicine costs much higher than elsewhere in the world.

title: "Refugees Or Illegal Entrants?": Top Court On Rohingyas' Status In India
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday said the first major issue to be dealt with in cases concerning Rohingyas is whether they are refugees or illegal entrants.

title: Another FIR Filed Against Akali Dal Leader Bikram Majithia For Obstructing Vigilance Bureau During Raid
content: Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Singh Majithia and his supporters have been booked for allegedly obstructing the state vigilance bureau during a raid in Amritsar last month, sources said on Thursday.

title: Maharashtra Agriculture Minister Manikrao Kokate Removed After Rummy Row, Gets Sports
content: Maharashtra minister Manikrao Kokate - knee-deep in controversy after being caught on camera playing an online card game in the assembly -- was moved from Agriculture to the Sports ministry

title: IIT Kharagpur moves to prevent suicides, removes ceiling fans, adds ‚ÄòCampus Mothers‚Äô

content: Vishwa Mohan is Senior Editor at The Times of India. He writes on environment, climate change, agriculture, water resources and clean energy, tracking policy issues and climate diplomacy. He has been covering Parliament since 2003 to see how politics shaped up domestic policy and India‚Äôs position at global platform. Before switching over to explore sustainable development issues, Vishwa had covered internal security and investigative agencies for more than a decade. title: Maha polls: Tests prove EVMs tamper-proof; 'no mismatch between count, slips'
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‚Äòprime‚Äô political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India‚Äôs neighbourhood. title: MLB trade deadline recap: Correa to Astros and all the moves that rocked deadline day
content: the 2025 trade deadline has officially passed, with contending teams making a flurry of late moves before 6 p.m. ET arrived . the San Diego Padres made a blockbuster move ahead of deadline day with a late-night deal with the Arizona Diamondbacks for Eugenio Suarez .

title: Wrexham celebrate Wales' connection with Argentina in stunning third kit
content: Wrexham return to the second tier of English football in 2025-26 . the club are just one step below the premier league . a new kit has a distinct inflection of world cup holders Argentina .

title: Mets find CF fix, trade for Orioles veteran Mullins
content: the Mets acquired center fielder cedric Mullins from the Baltimore Orioles . the 30-year-old is set to be a free agent after this season . he's hitting .229 with 15 home runs and a .738 OPS in 91 games for Baltimore .

title: Nunez, Grealish among Premier League stars who need a transfer
content: the start of the 2025-26 premier league season is just two weeks away . the summer transfer window is about to enter its final month . a drop down to less glamorous or successful club could be the best option . click here for all the latest premier league news .

title: Insurance RB rankings: Charbonnet, Guerendo lead the way
content: Zach Charbonnet is a priority insurance running back for fantasy managers . this concept applies to fantasy football . he was rostered in just 22% of ESPN leagues entering Week 1 . but he emerged as a league winner after the Buccaneers' week 11 bye .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Jags' Thomas, Lawrence working on connection
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL, and our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room .

title: Free agency Power Rankings: Where the Rockets, Raptors and others land
content: the 2025-26 offseason is in full swing . some teams are settling in with their newly acquired superstars . the Houston Rockets acquired 15-time All-Star Kevin Durant from the Phoenix Suns in June . other veteran names were also on the move this offseason .

title: Source: Commanders' McLaurin requests trade
content: a source says Terry McLaurin has requested a trade . he was frustrated with negotiations on a contract extension . there has been no movement toward a new deal, one source says . the commanders receiver could no longer be fined $50,000 per day .

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022 . 68 trades on deadline day went down with a flurry of activity . the Astros traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for leo de Vries .

title: üèà CFB's toughest and easiest schedules for '25
content: college football is for the first time in history sharing revenue with athletes . the start of the 2025 season is less than a month away . it's time to hand out some superlatives, some flattering and some not so flattering .
